problem.title: Video Tutorial: a Block on an inclined plane

img.alt: Block at rest on an incline

p.b: Part 1: A block is at rest...

problem.p: A block of mass m is at rest on an incline plane of angle \(\alpha\) with respect to the vertical. There is friction between the block and the incline surface (\(\mu\)k and \(\mu\)s).

a) What is the value of the normal force exerted by the incline on the block? Express your answer in terms of some or all of the variables m, g, \(\mu\)s, \(\mu\)k, and \(\alpha\). To write \(\mu\)s, \(\mu\)k, or \(\alpha\), use mus, muk, or alpha.

b) What is the value of the force of friction exerted by the surface on the block? Express your answer in terms of some or all of the variables m, g, \(\mu\)s, \(\mu\)k, and \(\alpha\). To write \(\mu\)s, \(\mu\)k, or \(\alpha\), use mus, muk, or alpha.
c) If you were able to change the angle of the incline plane, at what angle will the block start to slide?

For an angle smaller than the one calculated in part c), a steeper slope, the block will slide down. What is the block's acceleration? Express your answer in some or all of the variables m, g, \(\mu\)s, \(\mu\)k, and \(\alpha\). To write \(\mu\)s, \(\mu\)k, or \(\alpha\), use mus, muk, or alpha.
